p: We first estimated the genetic variance in viral load within our mapping population. The results recapitulated what we had found above in a natural population of flies â€” there was considerably more genetic variation in susceptibility to the coevolved virus than the non-coevolved viruses ( Figure 4A, filled circles). Therefore, our earlier result from a single population holds when sampling flies from across six continents, although the magnitude of the effect is considerably greater in this mapping population.
